Hi,

The ToeThreads active count is proprtional to the number of virtual
queues in the system. i.e. the number of hosts in your crawl targets.
After a certain point, the crawler slows down because of politeness
settings. Every thread contends to get the next URI from the frontier
but since there are not too many hosts in your crawl bucket, the
politeness settings do not let release the next URI unless certain
politeness threshold  time settings have elapsed. Usually , a single
host/domain crawl provides a much lower throughput than a multi-domain
crawl.

Solution :  Broad Crawls

Hope this helps.

Anmol
